clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of EECP on Anterior Ischemic Optic Neuropathy
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Effect of EECP on Anterior Ischemic Optic Neuropathy

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: Enhanced External Counterpulsation(EECP) therapy may promote the recovery of visual function by improving the blood perfusion of eyes. The present study aims to investigate the effect of EECP on Anterior Ischemic Optic Neuropathy.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with Anterior Ischemic Optic Neuropathy are randomized into two groups: one group receive standard medical treatment for ischemic optic neuropathy, the other group plus EECP therapy besides standard medical treatment.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

arm_group.description: Enhanced external counterpulsation (EECP) is a noninvasive modality for the treatment of ischemic cardiovascular disease. EECP therapy is done by sequential inflation of 3 sets of cuffs wrapped around the lower extremities during diastole and deflation of the cuffs during systole.
The subjects with Anterior ischemic Optic Neuropathy received aspirin therapy.

intervention.description: EECP is performed for 1 hours every day, for a total of 36 hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ischemic optic neuropathy
- within 1 month
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hemorrhagic disease
- thrombophlebitis or infection lesions
- severe hypertensive patients
- Atrial fibrillation
- Aortic regurgitation
